p: Paying more attention to the introduction of micronutrients and vitamins is the only immunoprotection strategy we have available and for which there is sufficient evidence available on both the effectiveness and safety of the intervention. The recommended protocol includes optimizing the consumption of these compounds, particularly by the elderly and by pregnant women, in whom the epigenetic effects may be more pronounced. In some cases, the possibility of supplementation, particularly with vitamin D (which is synthesized by sun exposure, often insufficient during the winter season); with long-chain omega 3 fatty acids in subjects who do not usually consume fish; vitamin C to ensure intakes of 200â€‰mg/d (maximum bioavailability); and appropriate probiotics to maintain a state of eubiosis.
